description: TO ELECT THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES FOR THE 93RD CONGRESS.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H.RES. 6, ADOPTION OF THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES FOR THE 93RD CONGRESS.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 176, THE RULE PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H. RES. 132, A RESOLUTION TO CREATE A SELECT COMMITTEE TO STUDY THE OPERATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF RULES X AND XI OF THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.  RULES X & XI RELATE TO THE PROCEDURES AND JURISDICTIONS OF THE STANDING COMMITTEES OF THE HOUSE.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 176, THE RULE PROVIDING FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H. RES. 132.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H. J. RES. 123, A BILL TO AMEND SECTION 123 OF THE FEDERAL-AID HIGHWAY ACT OF 1970, ESTABLISHING THE COMM. ON HIGHWAY BEAUTIFICATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 2107 SO AS TO RESTRICT REPA PAYMENTS TO FARMERS WITH AN AVERAGE ANNUAL NET INCOME OF $10,000 OR LESS.

TO PASS H. R. 3577, A BILL TO PROVIDE AN EXTENSION OF THE INTEREST EQUALIZATION TAX.

TO AMEND SEN. ABOURZEK'S AMENDMENT TO S.354, TO ESTABLISH NATIONAL NO-FAULT INSURANCE, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT A PERSON REMAINS LIABLE FOR NON ECONOMIC DETRIMENT IN CASES WHERE THE VICTIM SUSTAINS MORE THAN 90 CONTINUOUS DAYS OF TOTAL DISABILITY RATHER THAN 6 CONTINUOUS MONTHS AS PROVIDED IN THE BILL OR 60 DAYS, AS ABOUREZK'S AMENDMEN PROVIDE.

TO AMEND S.354, BY ALLOWING STATES WHICH ALREADY HAVE NO-FAULT PLANS AN ADDITIONAL PERIOD OF UP TO 4 YEAR COMPLY WITH FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS.

TO AMEND S.354 BY MAKING GROUP HEALTH INSURANCE PROVISIONS AVAILABLE AT THE OPTION OF A STATE.

TO AMEND GURNEY AMENDMENT TO S. 1539.  THE GURNEY AMENDMENT PROHIBITS FORCED BUSING OF STUDENTS BEYOND THE SCHOOL NEXT CLOSEST TO HIS HOME.  THE BAYH AMENDMENT, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, REQUIRES THAT ALL ALTERNATIVE METHODS FOR REMEDYING, DE JRERE SEGREGATION BE USED BEFORE BUSING OF STUDENTS IS ORDERED OR PROPOSED.

TO AMEND S.1539 SO AS TO PROVIDE FREEDOM OF CHOICE IN ATTENDING PUBLIC SCHOOLS.

TO AMEND S.1539 BY ADDING A NEW SECTION TO PROHIBIT IMPLEMENTATION OF COURT-ORDERED BUSING IN THE MIDDLE OF A SCHOOL YEAR. 68
TO TABLE SEN. GRIFFIN'S AMENDMENT TO S.1539 WHICH AS ORIGINALLY OFFERED, WAS ANTI-BUSING LANGUAGE SIMILAR TO AN AMENDMENT OF SEN. GURNEY'S WHICH WAS DEFEATED THE DAY BEFORE.

TO TABLE THE SCOTT OF (PA.)-MANSFIELD AMENDMENT TO HIS AMENDMENT TO TO S.1539. AS EXPLAINED BY SEN. SCOTT, THEIR AMENDMENT DOES NOT DIFFER FROM SEN. GRIFFIN EXCEPT IN AN EXPLICIT STATEMENT THAT THE SENATE DOES NOT INTEND TO VIOLATE THE CONSTITUTION OF THE U.S.

TO TABLE SEN. ERVIN'S AMENDMENT TO S.1539 WHICH DENIES TO U.S. COURTS JURISDICTION TO ORDER SCHOOL BUSING BY STATE OR LOCAL EDUCATION AGENCIES TO ALTER THE RACIAL COMPOSITION OF THE STUDENT BODY, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE SUPREME COURT WHEN ACTING WITHIN ITS ORIGINAL JURISDICTION.
TO AMEND S.1539 BY SUBSTITUTING PARENTAL CONSENT FOR THE CONSENT OF LOCAL AUTHORITIES AS A CONDITION FOR FEDERAL FUNDING OF BUSING.

TO AGREE TO A SUBSTITUTE FOR S.1539, WHICH SUBSTITUTE IS PREDICATED ON THE ASSUMPTIONS THAT THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION PROGRAM HAS NOT BEEN OF MUCH BENEFIT TO THIS POINT, AND THAT STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS SHOULD BE STRENGTHENED.
TO TABLE SEN. SCOTT OF VA.'S AMENDMENT TO S.1539, VESTING IN STATE, RATHER THAN FEDERAL, COURTS JURISDICTION IN CASES INVOLVING PUBLIC ELEMENTARY OR SECONDARY SCHOOLS.

TO AMEND S.2543, A BILL TO AMEND THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT SO AS TO FACILITATE FREER ACCESS TO GOVERNMENT INFORMATION. THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT SUITS CONTESTING THE PROPRIETY OF AGENCY CLAIMS UNDER THE FIRST EXEMPTION WOULD BE HANDLED BY FEDERAL JUDGES IN THE SAME WAY AS CASES CHALLENGING THE VALIDITY OF CLAIMS UNDER THE EIGHT OTHER PERMISSIBLE EXEMPTIONS FROM THE ACT'S DISCLOSURE STANDARDS.
TO AMEND S.2543 BY ADDING LANGUAGE CLARIFYING CONGRESSIONAL INTENT AS TO DISCLOSURE OF INVESTIGATORY RECORDS.
TO PASS H.R. 12471, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF PROVISIONS OF THE SENATE COMPANION BILL, S.2543.

TO AMEND SEN. PERCY'S AMENDMENT TO S.3523, TO ESTABLISH A TEMPORARY NATIONAL COMMISSION ON SUPPLIES AND SHORTAGES. THE PERCY AMENDMENT LIMITS LIFE OF COMMISSION TO 1 INSTEAD OF 3 YEARS AND REDUCES APPROPRIATIONS THEREFORE TO $500,000. THE TUNNEY AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES $1 MILLION FOR EACH OF FISCAL YEARS 1975 & 1976.

TO REFER S.3523, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A TEMPORARY NATIONAL COMMISSION ON SUPPLIES AND SHORTAGES, JOINTLY TO THE COMMITTEES ON GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS, COMMERCE, AND INTERIOR AND INSULAR AFFAIRS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO BE REPORTED BACK BY JULY 19.

ON DECIDING THE QUESTION RAISED BY SEN. FONG: IS AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 14434, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT FOR FISCAL 1975, GERMANE AND RELEVANT?  THE AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE EPA TO TRANSFER FUNDS TO OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES FOR ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT THAT IT MAY NOT BE IN A POSITION TO SUPPLY OR OBTAIN BY CONTRACT.
TO AMEND H.R. 14434 BY DELETING $1.4 MILLION FOR BASIC RE- SEARCH IN THE FIELD OF NUCLEAR STIMULATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES.

TO AMEND S.3355, PROVIDING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE FOR OPERATION OF THE DRUG ENFORCEMENT ADMINISTRATION, BY REPEALING THE SO-CALLED NO-KNOCK STATUTE PASSED BY THE CONGRESS IN 1970.

TO AMEND SEN. MONDALE'S AMENDMENT TO S.3355.  THE MONDALE AMENDMENT BARS U.S. ECONOMIC AND MILITARY AID TO ANY GOVERN- MENT WHICH PERMITS THE PRODUCTION OF OPIUM POPPIES AND WHICH DOES NOT EFFECTIVELY PREVENT THE DIVERSION OF OPIUM AND ITS DERIVATIVES INTO INTERNATIONAL MARKETS.  THE TOWER AMENDMENT THERETO DELETES CONGRESSIONAL PEROGATIVES THEREIN AND ALLOWS THE PRES. TO WAIVE CERTAIN OF ITS PROVISIONS IF REQUIRED BY NATIONAL SECURITY INTEREST.

TO TABLE SCOTT (PA) MANSFIELD AMENDMENT TO HOUSE AMENDMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 16900, A BILL MAKING SUPPLEMEN- TAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1975.  THE AMENDMENT IN QUESTION IS THE SO-CALLED HOLT AMENDMENT, WHICH, AT THIS POINT IN THE BILL'S HISTORY, NOW PROVIDES THAT NONE OF THESE FUNDS SHALL BE USED TO COMPEL ANY SCHOOL SYSTEM, AS A CONDITION FOR RECEIVING GRANTS TO CLASSIFY TEACHERS OR STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, SEX, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN OR TO ASSIGN STUDENTS OR TEACHERS TO SCHOOLS OR CLASSES ON THIS BASIS. THE SCOTT-MANSFIELD AMENDMENT ADDS THE WORDS:  EXCEPT AS MAY BE REQUIRED TO ENFORCE THE NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION OF FEDERAL LAWS.
